Event.name: Infecting
Event.definition:
<def-root>The action of spreading some <fen>Infection</fen> to an <fen>Infected_entity</fen>, intentionally or otherwise. Pathology indicates that the <fen>Infection_cause</fen> can be airborne, carried on the skin/hair, or transmitted via various other forms of contact.
<ex><fex name="Infection_cause">Her daughter</fex> <t>infected</t> <fex name="Infected_entity">her</fex> <fex name="Infection">with chicken pox</fex> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Infection
Arg.definition: <def-root>An invasion, typically undetected, of an entity's system. The infection most often compromises the entity's stability. Infections are a common pathology for diseases.</def-root>

Arg.name: Infected_entity
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE labels the recipient of the <fen>Infection</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Infection_cause
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE labels the cause of the <fen>Infection</fen> which affects the <fen>Infected_entity</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Medium
Arg.definition: <def-root>The medium through which the infection is transmitted.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the Infecting event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification, force, secondary effects, and general descriptions comparing events.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The place at which the Infecting event occurs; or, the location of the Infection_cause.</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Depictive phrase describing a participant in the event.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An act by an <fen>Infection_cause</fen> that enables them to act upon the <fen>Infected_entity</fen>. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: give.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: An Infection of an Infected_entity occurs, with or without the intention or knowledge of the Infection_cause.

lexUnit.name: infect.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to have a disease.
